examples: As a personal favour to me,                please don't release my story to the press.
I came here to ask you a favour, a big favour.
Although I am friends with the tennis ace, I don't expect any favours from him on                court.
Rodrigo accepted the favours bestowed on him by the new                king. Do yourself a favour and cut your credit cards in half.
I'll ask Jane. She                owes me a favour.
Thanks very much. I'll return the favour one day.
Traditionally, vigilante groups have found greater favour                on the political right. He stood in high favour at the court of Lewis the Pious.
In the Christian tradition, the world exists only as an act of                divine favour.
The bishop was said to have enjoyed the                king's favour.
Her political views have not found favour in recent                years.
trying to curry favour with the teachers
As an                examiner, she showed no favour to any candidate.
The senior officials were punished and rapidly fell from favour. This idea has long since                fallen out of favour.
A style of art can                go out of fashion and then come back into favour fifty years later.
to argue in favour of this policy
The committee came down in favour of setting up a national body. The High Court                found in favour of the plaintiffs.
Environmental conservation generally works in                favour of maintaining the status quo.
The golf tournament went in the Americans'                favour
He is strongly in favour of capital punishment. Early in his musical                career he abandoned blues in favour of jazz.
This piece of software has two                points in its favour: it's fast and inexpensive.
She is too popular with the                public to find much favour with the critics.
an argument in favour of censorship
Depth of training is looked upon                    with favour by many employers.

words: without fear or favour (= in a fair way)
